summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary sworn interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General on July 15, 2021, with a Federal Correctional Officer from MCC New York. The interview focuses on the officer's knowledge of events surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 9-10, 2019, including Epstein's prior suicide attempt, his cell assignments, cellmates, institutional procedures, and the officer's interactions with Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate at the center of the OIG investigation into his death at MCC New York. The interview discusses his suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, his cell assignments, cellmates, and his demeanor.

persons.name: Stacey Richman
persons.context: Attorney from Richman Hill and Associates, present to represent the Federal Correctional Officer being interviewed by the OIG.

persons.name: Matthew Fooksman
persons.context: Legal intern working for Stacey Richman, present during the OIG interview.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Inmate who was Jeffrey Epstein's first cell mate in Special Housing. The officer describes responding to Epstein's July 23 suicide attempt in the cell they shared.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Inmate who was Jeffrey Epstein's cell mate after he returned from suicide watch. The officer states Reyes was shipped out either the day before or the morning of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate mentioned in the Lieutenant's log as being placed on a dry cell in R&D on August 9, 2019. The officer discusses the procedures for moving an inmate to a dry cell.

connections.description: Epstein's first cell mate in Special Housing. The officer states that after Epstein's July 23 suicide attempt, Epstein asked to be put back with Tartaglione but was denied, leading the officer to assume Epstein had claimed Tartaglione tried to harm him.
Epstein's cell mate after he returned from suicide watch. The officer states Reyes was shipped out shortly before Epstein's death.
Richman is an attorney and Fooksman is her legal intern, both present to represent the correctional officer during the OIG interview.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide in his Special Housing Unit cell while cell mate Tartaglione was present. The officer interviewed was a responding officer and found Epstein with a sheet around his neck, sitting on the floor, having attempted to hang himself from the bed ladder.

events.title: Epstein's Phone Call
events.description: On the evening of August 9, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was allowed to make an unmonitored phone call from the Special Housing Unit. The officer states Epstein was happy about finally getting the call, but the officer was not present for it and does not know who authorized it or who was called.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC New York. The officer interviewed worked the evening watch on August 9 and was not present when Epstein was found.

events.title: Inmate Fernandez Moved to Dry Cell
events.description: According to the Lieutenant's log, inmate Fernandez was placed on a dry cell in R&D at 3:15 p.m. on August 9, 2019. The officer explains dry cell procedures are used when an inmate is suspected of swallowing contraband.

events.title: OIG Interview of Correctional Officer
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary sworn interview with a Federal Correctional Officer from MCC New York as part of its investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
Department of Justice Office of Inspector General New York Field Office
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
R&D (Receiving and Discharge) at MCC New York
keyFacts: The officer was a responding officer to Jeffrey Epstein's first suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, finding him with a sheet around his neck, sitting on the floor of his SHU cell.

Epstein's first cell mate was inmate Tartaglione. After the suicide attempt, Epstein asked to be put back with Tartaglione but was denied, leading the officer to believe Epstein had accused Tartaglione of attempting to harm him.
Epstein's cell mate after returning from suicide watch was inmate Efrain Reyes, who was shipped out either the day before or the morning of Epstein's death.
On the evening of August 9, 2019, Epstein made an unmonitored phone call from the SHU and was reportedly happy about it. The officer does not know who authorized the call or who was called.

The officer discusses BOP procedures including court lists, count slips, ghost counting, dry cell protocols, and the SENTRY and TRUACCESS computer systems, noting irregularities in some count slips from August 9-10.
The officer states his belief that Epstein took his own life and is not aware of anyone attempting to harm him.
